reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFlobe is like breakout without balls"Flobe is a quick reactions
date:
skill game with a simple but good game concept. The controls feel in the first moment quite uncommon but you'll get used to it quickly (you control each side of the bar over twinsticks or A or D keys).
Collect with the powerbar the floating blobs of your color like in a fishing net.
Deny the contagious green ones and the unexplodeable missiles
Try to startle all bombs but dodge their explosion circleLateron you'll see it's totally challenging and merciless. Do not ever let drop a blob at the bottom of the screen. You'll be double punished.
1.your bar becomes longer and less controlable
2.your multiplier drops to zero.

Around a score of 2k and a multiplier of 15x your bar gets twincolored. Means left blue
recommended: right purple. Ofc you still can just collect the blobs with the right matching color. Hopefully the devs can somehow speedup the movements and control ability during EA. Not gonna go above 15x multiplier yet ...\n\nUpdate: The ability to change colorsides is much better than to flipover and gives the game some depth. Forget to mention the soundtrack is quite enjoyable. Ambient music of the 70's like ska or jazz"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is amazing.

Seriously. I completed a badge and saw I got a coupon for 50% off some game called Flobe. I clicked on it to see if it interested me. At first I was disappointed because I saw what looked like a kind of cheap, dime-a-dozen arcade game. I looked farther into the game though, and it interested me. Being that with the coupon, the game was only 50 cents, I decided to buy it.

What I got was the best 99 cent game on steam to be known in a unique and addicting arcade game. The controls are a bit wonky, but they make sense and are very responsive, and anyway, the weirdness of the controls keeps the game challenging. The graphics are fine, and actually better than I expected. Don't use the trailer as reference, because it looks a lot different than the game now, which looks much nicer. On top of all that, the music is amazing! It's something you don't see a lot in arcade games like this, and it really makes it much more enjoyable in comparison to some 9 second loop  you'd hear in some other arcade game.

If there was anything I would complain about it would be that there are a few annoying bugs, but being that the game is in EA, those will get sorted out in due time.

9/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nJust finished a playthrough of FLOBE for a new youtube channel -- we had a blast, will probably reveal more info than a text based review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3zGWgs6bnw0

Early Access Review\n\nThe controls took me a few tries to wrap my head around; but once i did the flow was well communicated and I was quick to start chasing a high score. Perfect pacing for a game that you can play on the bus.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFirst releases of early access games aren't typically as fun as most would hope. We expect bugs, graphics issues and some core issues. Admittedly I only played the  game a few times but it's clean, solid (so far) and surprisingly difficult to stop playing once you get the hang of it. Controller is a must I think. Nice casual game that's easy to pick up once in a while if you don't mind loosing track of  the time. Check it out, certainly worth it, even at this stage of development.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFun mechanic. Fun game. Very stripped down though. No real menus or anything. Just throws you right in. It would be interesting to see this turned into a multiplayer game somehow.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It is an easy game, the ones you wanna play but not really think about it.

It is hard at the beginning to use the keyboard and as an early access game no instructions or menu is in the game, so it was useful to read about the game/description to understand the goal or concept.

Recommended for just chilling (I would played for a few minutes once in a while), looking forward for some improvements as it could have more potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CbY6MShq0cM

Quick thoughts: Fun little game that felt like Dr. Mario crossed with Arkanoid. Had a hard time putting it down, honestly. Some simple achievements, easy learning curve, though definitely a lot easier with the controller and played as a twin-stick shooter.

I'll have a more in-depth look shortly but for now wanted to give this a thumbs up, as it is a fun little time waster.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nLove the game so far. I am at a high score of 2502 right now, and I am trying SO hard to beat it. Just found one bug in the x30 multiplier achievement. It says i have 15/50 instead of 15/30. Apart from that the game works just fine.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Greetings fellow gamers! This is Gamer Guy (In a Suit) from the Echo Army YouTube channel! Today I am bringing you a review of the incredibly addictive casual indie game, Flobe. Flobe was released on Steam Januray 23, 2016 by Developers Skinny Jean Death Studios & Porcelain Labs and Publisher Forever Humble PDX.

(NOTE: This game was reviewed using a key provided by the Developer and/or Publisher)

Video Review:
https://youtu.be/0hGvtLpMfDs

The Too Long
hoursPlayed:
less than a buck. 5/5

The "Meat & Potatoes" Review:
Flobe. It is pronounced just as it looks. Flobe. Flobe is a casual little strategy-type indie arcade game with a puzzle feel to it. Essentially you are a blue "bar" that can move all around the screen
votesTotal: you need to catch these little blue guys flying down the screen. Seems simple enough
votesFunny: but there are other colors. Catching another color will end the game
commentsCount: making you start over. Missing one of your own "collectibles" to catch
column16: however does NOT kill you. It only makes the game harder from that point forward by forcing your bar to become one size larger
column17: which can become a pain quite quickly. You need all the mobility you can get in the game! Keep collecting though
column19: and your score multiplier increases. Once you hit 15X
column20: the game exands itself and now you find yourself chasing 2 colors. IT ramps up quickly! The first thing you notice
column21: is that it is very pretty.Very visually appealing. It has both fantastic graphics
column22: and great sound too. The controls are very responsive and slick. Just make sure to use a controller
column23: as the game was definitely designed with that in mind. The gameplay is so addicting. It is your basic arcade game in that your motivation is to keep increasing your top score. Trust me
column24: you've never had enough. This may be the indie-casual-arcadey type version of "One More Turn".\n\n5/5 for my tastes. It is under a dollar
column26: easy to pick up and difficult to master. Go give it a shot
column27: and when you do I want you to keep one thing in mind too.....the kid the coded this fantastic game is a mere 14 years old...if this is what we get while he's 14
column28: we have a bright gaming future ahead! Keep an eye on this Forever Humble PDX studio..\n\nHappy Gaming!"
